subject: YAPC::EU Master classes - talks - hackathons
header: YAPC::EU is still 4 month away, but you can already register enjoying the early-bird discount. The call for master classes, hackathons and talks is still open.
In the meantime the German Perl Workshop is just around the corner.

entries.title: Perl Jobs on the Perl Maven site
entries.text: Are you looking for a Perl job? Find it listed on the Perl Maven site.

entries.title: German Perlworkshop 2015 - this week
entries.author: steffen_schwigon
entries.text: May 6th - 8th, 2015 in Dresden, Germany. Please note, there is a strike by the train drivers of the Deutsche Bahn. Plan your journey accordingly!

entries.title: YAPC::EU Master classes - talks - hackathons
entries.text: There are currently 2 master classes, but if you'd like to run your own training class, you can still propose one. Same with Hackathons. There are 34 accepted talks so far. More are needed.

entries.title: Three Tales of Second System Syndrome
entries.author: brent_laabs
entries.text: Comparing the release of Python 3, the lack of release of PHP 6, and the imminent release of Perl 6.

entries.title: More QA Hackathon reports
entries.text: Although Neil has sent a collection of reports last week, more reports have arrived: Philippe Bruhat (BooK) the French Perl Monger who wrote Act; Olaf Alders from MetaCPAN.

entries.title: Explaining the Schwartzian Transform
entries.author: dave_jacoby
entries.text: Code with some comments.

entries.title: Perl Catalyst 5.90090 Has Landed
entries.author: john_napiorkowski
entries.text: Solid backwards compatibility and the biggest new features is Arg and CaptureArg type constraints.

entries.title: Increasing the likelihood of a PR merge
entries.author: neil_bowers
entries.text: The CPAN PR Challenge of Neil has been working quite well and helped Neil to refine his advice on what would constitute a good Pull Request. He points out that if the change is really useful that will make it much more likely to grab the attention of the author and he gives a number of 'best practices' on communicating with the author and making it easier for her/him to integrate the changes.

entries.title: Plotting the CPAN river â€” a first dabble
entries.author: neil_bowers
entries.text: Last week Neil proposed describing CPAN and the interdependencies as a flowing from its root, perl itself to the ocean of ... This week he started to draw the river.

entries.title: Curating old releases on CPAN
entries.author: neil_bowers
entries.text: What to do with distributions last released in 1995? Should they be removed from CPAN? Updated? Left alone?

entries.title: Abandoning all Perl modules
entries.author: caleb_cushing
entries.text: Caleb has stopped using Perl. You can take over modules from him. See more info.

entries.title: Maintaining the Perl 5 Core: Report, Months 17, & 18
entries.author: dave_mitchell
entries.text: Dave spent the month mainly fixing issues reported by the Coverity static code analyser, and fixing assorted bugs that were in the main 5.22 blockers.

entries.title: Call For Grant Proposals (May 2015 Round)

entries.text: Dead-line for the TPF grant proposals is 15th May.

entries.title: This week: the big NFG switch on, and many fixes

entries.text: Rakudo on MoarVM uses NFG (Normal Form Grapheme) now

entries.title: Parsing Perl 5 pod with Perl 6
entries.author: david_farrell
entries.text: A good exercise in using Perl 6

entries.title: A general profile photo that looks in the camera
entries.author: flavio_poletti
entries.text: Flavio reminds us all that when you put a picture of a person on a slide (or a blog post, or an e-mail), make sure the person does not look away from the text. Either the person on the side should look at the text, s/he should straight ahead. The latter will indicate that the person on the page is interested in the reader.

entries.title: Dada Mail Eight Released
entries.author: justin_simoni
entries.text: Dada Mail is an Open Source Contemporary Mailing List Manager written in Perl. This release moved from CGI to FastCGI and Plack/PSGI.
